headline: Ground Turkey Noodle Bake
description: This turkey and egg noodle casserole is a satisfying comfort food. Egg noodles are layered with turkey in seasoned tomato sauce and topped with mozzarella.

video.description: A noodle casserole with a creamy special ingredient!
video.name: Ground Turkey Noodle Bake

name: Ground Turkey Noodle Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add turkey and onion; cook and stir until turkey is browned and crumbly and onion is soft, about 10 minutes. Drain.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain and return to the pot.

While the water is coming to a boil for the noodles, stir tomato sauce and Italian seasoning into turkey mixture. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.

At the same time, combine milk, cream cheese, parsley, and garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until cream cheese melts, about 5 minutes. Pour over egg noodles and stir to combine. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
Layer turkey mixture over noodles. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over top.
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is hot and cheese is melted, 15 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This turned out great, did an 8oz brick of cream cheese. We also added a small can of diced tomatoes with green chilies. An 8 x 11.5 glass casserole pan was the perfect size for us.
This was a big hit with my family! Simple and easy to make. One question: Does it freeze well?

Great tasty casserole! I used more noodles and added another 1/2 cup milk and 1 cup plain yogurt. To the turkey mixture, I added 1 tsp minced garlic, 14.5 oz diced tomatoes, 4 oz mushroom pieces, 1 chopped rib of celery, and 10 oz chopped frozen spinach. Also, I tripled the Italian seasoning. I will make this again!
my family loved this recipe, especially my daughter. It was easy and the flavor was spot on, only change I added some mushrooms I had on hand.

This is a great recipe which we have made several times and shared with others. The only change I made was to add a can of Rotel tomatoes. Do not eliminate the tomato sauce. Let the casserole sit for 5minutes after baking. YUM!

I never thought of putting cream cheese on noodles and boy was it good!! I added celery to the onions to add more veggies, used spaghetti sauce and added a hit of hot sauce and worschester sauce to the turkey. I have 3 teens and they are eating at all different times so I made this in the afternoon and the kids could eat reheat anytime. This one will be added to my rotation.
We really like this recipe. I make it almost every week. But I’d like to see anyone who doesn’t employ an army of sous chefs prep it in 15 minutes. It uses a lot of dishes too.
Very good
This meal was delicious! I think it fits in a 13x9 pan better though.
We all liked it but didn't like how soupy the sauce on the noodles is.
I didn't follow the directions exactly, and did not layer the meat mixture on top on the noodles, instead I combined it all, but it was still delicious!

The recipe is just fine as written - it’s even better the next day. But as others suggested, I added a bit of Worcestershire sauce for more flavor. And next time I’ll probably increase the cream cheese to 6 oz (just because I love it so much!). Definitely will make again.

I added more seasoning (to my taste), but followed the main recipe ingredients and instructions- IT WAS DELICIOUS! Most importantly, it was filling, easy and quick to prepare for dinner! Love this one!

Like others, I found this was pretty bland, but liked the concept enough to keep the recipe for future experimentation. It needs more garlic in both the sauce and the cream cheese mixture, and more flavorful cheese (I'm thinking of adding Parmesan with the noodles and on top). The parsley adds good color, but no real flavor - I'm going to try using oregano next time. A good start!

I was not too sore about this. I’m not a huge fan of pasta with red sauce, but I was nicely surprised! The cream cheese sauce gave the pasta a very nice flavor, and even my picky reassures loved it! One of the kids hates onions, so I subbed for onion powder, which he never minds. I also subbed the parsley for fresh cilantro. Super good!

This recipe was easy and delicious however, it needed more sauce. The next time I make this recipe I will use a jar of my homemade spaghetti sauce rather than the tomato sauce. With only cooking for two now that my kids are grown, I was able to prepare this recipe in two loaf pans, one to eat now and one to freeze for another date! Total win!
Tasty recipe if you enjoy ground turkey. Easier than lasagna since not multi-layered.

My family loves this recipe and I probably make it once a week. It tastes like lasagna. My picky 4 year old loves it too. Since the first time I made this I have made a few tweaks that work for my family. I use two regular size jars of spaghetti sauce or one large size usually in a three cheese variety instead of the tomato sauce from the recipe. I also use 4 cups of dried egg noodles and the whole package of cream cheese 8oz. I then do 2 layers (think lasagna) noodles-meat sauce-mozzarella then repeat. I usually end up using more mozzarella than recipe calls for as well since I have 2 layers. I sometimes push frozen meatballs on top just til covered for added depth. Easy dinner whole family loves!! I also melt the cream cheese in microwave with milk just for ease and it works well. The garlic I cook in the meat mixture with the onion. Enjoy!!

This was amazing. I hate American Chop Suey and the end result looked similar, but way better. I did add stewed tomatoes, a 1/2 cup of pasta sauce and enough Italian seasoning and garlic to my families liking.
Love this recipe! Wouldn’t change a thing!!
I will use a small amount of chili flakes and maybe put a bit of chopped spinach in the mix as well. But all in all it was a delicious meal
So easy to make. Super yummy. Family loved it.
Love this dish. I added 2 medium zucchini this time and left out cream cheese sauce.
Both my husband and i were pleasantly surprised with how yummy this turned out. I added some olives and cauliflower to mine as well.
It was very good! Comfort food!

Great weeknight meal. Any and all changes of previous reviewers add value. I threw 1 tbsp of mustard and Worcestershire sauce, a teaspoon of Italian seasoning and onion powder. I like a little heat so next time I'll add 1 tbsp of red pepper flakes

This was delicious! It has a comfort food, lasagna-like taste. I read a few reviews and decided to season the ground turkey using a tenderizer. Someone mentioned the cheese might burn at 375. It almost did, but I just kept an eye on it and covered it with tin foil when it was dark enough. Next time I make this I am going to use double the noodles. I just felt it was heavy on meat and not enough noodles. So good, though!

I made this with what I had on hand, and with some suggestions from reviews and it was really tasty comfort food. I used Tillamook cream cheese (aged cheddar which is very mild and flavorful), and a little dried garlic (1/2 tsp) in the cream sauce 'cause I ran out of time. I added about a tablespoon of worchestire sauce and 2 tsp of Better than Boullion veggie bouillion base (chicken would be fine too) to the turkey before adding the tomato sauce. And for the tomato sauce I added half a jar of marinara I needed to use up. It was really good! My kids are young and sometimes picky and they enjoyed it too. I'll be making it again. It seems a little complex, but if you cook a lot, it only takes about 20 minutes to come together and another 25 to bake (I did at 350 and it turned out great). I also buttered the pan for extra flavor.
I made it as is...my teens and husband loved it. Just made it again. Very easy too!
Nothing great and nothing wrong with it. Tasty. I might add mushrooms next time.
Kind of bland
Next time I make it I’ll add a can of cream of mushroom soup to make it creamier
Tweaked it a little. 350 for 30 min. No parsley, extra Italian seasoning, doubled the garlic. Added the seasoning and the garlic to the sauce/meat mixture. PERFECT.
This was a big hit and so delicious.
I would use a good Spagetti Sauce next time so that I could get more flavor.

I followed the recipe exactly and this was simple and very good. Tastes like lasagna and can't even tell it's ground turkey. I think next time I'll add garlic powder and make a little more cream sauce. Definitely a keeper.

No instructions to make the sauce. I realized that to incorporate the cream cheese it had to be heated. The result was a gloppy, much too thick sauce, especially after the cheese was added. Sorry, not a favorite.
Very easy and good!
excellent. Did it for 2 servings in a very small casserole.
I used Fettucini, about 1/2 box. My 21 yo son loved it. I thought it was a bit heavy. 12 points WW green plan.
I used gluten free noodles and loved it. So easy to make, thank you!
This is a great recipe and very versatile. We add vegetables that we need to get rid of. A great one for teens to make!

I am stuck inside (NJ quarantine) and wanted to try something different. This fit the bill! A slightly healthier version of a casserole. I did increase the Italian seasoning to around a tablespoon (as others suggested), used the entire bag of noodles and put it in a 12x8 casserole dish. Everyone loved it!
I liked it, I get sick of making the same things over and over so this was a nice change and super easy to make.

Turned out great! I doubled it & cooked in oven for about 15 mins. I used 6 C egg noodles, 2 LB ground turkey, 24 oz jar of marinara, 1 C milk (actually a little over since i used up last bit of half & half sitting in my fridge) 1 block cream cheese (8oz). I had to add a little of water to my turkey/marinara so i could bring it to a boil. added salt & seasonings. Sprinkled a little bit of powdered chicken bouillon in pasta water. Only have garlic powder so used that in milk/cream cheese mixture. I did add couple of finely diced celery to my meat, it added a nice little crunch. Next time i'll add some other type of veggies, maybe a can peas & carrots. Main thing it was easy! i'm not a good cook, so this right up my alley.
Very good! But I didn’t use tomato sauce because I don’t like it, subbed spaghetti sauce. Added more garlic to the cream cheese mixture. Definitely will make again.
Mine was a little dry, I should have doubled the sauce! Excellent taste! I would make it again!
My family enjoyed it..
I would definitely make this again. The whole family loved it!

Overall it was simple, easy on the budget and delicious. I made the mistake of leaving it too long in the oven, 10 minutes was enough for the cheese to melt down. My husband and I are looking forward to the leftovers and making it again.
I made it just like the recipe, except that I used oregano instead of Italian spice. This was a very good recipe, and I would make it again.
I am 14 and I made this!!
Family liked this. I used marinara sauce instead of just tomato sauce and a bit more garlic. We will definitely be having this again

Made this almost exactly as the recipe stated. Changed pasta from egg noodles to bow tie and put garlic in both the meat and the sauce (I never measure garlic because I used jarred pre-minced, but it was probably just a little over 2 TBSP or so). I also added some (Lawry’s) seasoning salt, a little sea salt, and black pepper to the meat. I was probably more liberal with the Italian seasoning than the recipe called for. In short though, it was delicious! This will be going on our rotation!
Add a few ingredients, parmigiana and garlic salt to turkey mixture.
I cook as per introduction. Out of 7 of us only 3 liked. But will make it again.
My husband loved this dish. I did add some hot pepper flakes to zest it up a bit. And I lowered the calories by using low fat milk and cream cheese.
15 min prep time my behind
Grateful for the recipe. Added half-teaspoon of basil and oregano, some salt and sugar (teaspoon each). Could eat this every week!
Not bad. I used garlic powder and dried parsley out of sheer laziness and it came out just fine.

I made this with chopped Turkey left over from Thanksgiving instead of Ground Turkey. We liked it and I will definitely make it again. It was a lot going on at once, but overall it was easy and very good.
Yummy made as indicated
I would make this again. I added fresh spinach to the egg noodles to add some color and flavor. It was a good addition. Will be on my regular rotation.
Little flat tasting. I'll try diced tomatoes and a can of Rotel, maybe some mushrooms. Use Cheddar cheese on top.

Quick and simple dish for a busy day. If needed, you can easily adapt based on what is on hand in your fridge.

One hint is do not too much cream cheese. To my liking it would be very rich.

I added a can of petite tomatoes drained 
We love this recipe 
Leftovers are even better!

Hearty and very good—a big hit with the husband! I made it as written and it was delicious. It’s not only family-friendly and easy enough for a week night, but it would work for company too. Delighted to find another way to use ground turkey. There are ways to use this noodle bake as a base too and take off from here...next time I might try making it spicey, adding bacon, or using hamburger instead of turkey. Thanks for this one—it’s a new fav.
Yummy and so easy! Family liked it. Low calorie. Will make it again!
My family devoured it. Very easy to make and delicious. I made the recipe as is and it turned out perfect.
I substituted spaghetti squash for the egg noodles. Delish!
Loved it!! Turned out way better than expected
Very easy to make. Great flavor and perfect portion!
My kids absolutely LOVED it & my daughter wanted to take some for lunch at school. This recipe is a MUST!!!
I have made this a couple of times. Everyone in the family really enjoys it. After the first time I made it I thought the pasta was a little dry so I doubled the cream sauce. Still wonderful!
Needs more egg noodles
This turned out good. Next time I think I will double the cream mixture to make the pasta a little more creamy.
I just made this recipe and it was delicious and filling. All my kids liked it too which is a rarity. I wasn't sure what to expect, but trusted the good reviews and wasn't disappointed.

So easy and yummy! Husband doesn't like ground Turkey so instead used beef. To kick the flavor up a notch next time I plan to add more seasoning to the meat sauce mixture. With using beef it kinda tasted like lasagna. We discussed about naming the recipe either poor man's lasagna or lazy lasagna. Will definitely keep making it!
Our whole family - even all 3 kids (5, 3 and 1) loved this!

I made as written. The only change was I mixed the ground turkey with the noodles then sprinkled with cheese and baked it. One reviewer said the noodles did get hard in the oven. Very true. Fantastic. Will make again and again. Thanks.

I made this exactly as directed except I added some red pepper flakes and a jar of mushrooms I happened to have on hand. It was great and made an entire 9x13 pan. I took some to my neighbor and still had enough for 2 meals. It was easy and quite flavorful! I will make this again.

I followed the recipe exactly as written. The consistency was good but we felt it needed to be a little more flavorful. Next time I think I will use spaghetti sauce instead of tomato sauce and add some red pepper flakes and other spices.

It was delicious & my husband loved it. For the Italian seasoning, I used fresh rosemary and thyme, and dried marjoram and basil. I love onions and garlic, so in addition to what the recipe called for, I bought the canned tomatoes that included garlic and onion. Also, I opted for the shredded Italian 5 cheese mix, as opposed to just mozzarella. The flavors were enhanced nicely when I added sea salt to the meat and cream mixtures. Great dish!
Tomato sauce is too acidic for me so I substituted the tomato sauce for a jar of alfredo sauce. It was delicious!
Good, and we even used dairy free mozzarella and cream cheese.
The family loved this! I did add some dried basil, a splash of Merlot, and some minced garlic to the meat mixture, along with the Italian seasoning. It's definitely a keeper!
Didn't have turkey on hand, made it with chop meat. Very good and very filling. Will make it again
I made this exactly as written and it was delicious!
This has become a staple in our house. My picky husband has not accepted any lasagna-like dishes until this. A little heavy (not a diet dish). Quite tasty with mushrooms.
Just added a bit more noodles and meat. Very good.
Used spaghetti no noodles in the house also used 4 types of cheese and mini sweet peppers
Nice flavor and a healthy alternative with the ground turkey.
I will definitely be making this again. I followed the recipe, the only thing I might do the next time is add a little more Italian seasoning.

After reading comments I used less spaghetti and more sauce and will continue to do so. I did add 2 cloves of garlic to onion and ground beef. Rather than 2 cups of cottage cheese I used 1 cup cottage cheese, 1/2 cup ricotta, 1/2 cup sour cream and added parsley. I increased Parmesan to 2/3 cup and used garlic butter vs plain. I substituted the Mozzarella with Monterey Jack and Tex Mex. Mixing the egg mixture into the spaghetti really makes the dish!

It came out amazing!!! I used Prego Pasta sauce with veggies, so I didn’t need the Italian seasoning. Also, I used only half an onion and since I only had about 2.5 ounces of cream cheese, I put a tablespoon of butter. I am definitely making this again!
It was awesome! Made as listed.
Soo soo good! Make it! You will not be disappointed! So easy to make, does take a little time but it’s worth it! And the serving size is pretty spot on! This is going on our recipe book hall of fame!
Super yummy. Would definitely make again
I used penne instead of egg noodles, and more spices, and it was a big hit
